result.execSummary:
The defendant Kou Yang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Marathon County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kou Yang

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Amy. 
CAlled:  10:54 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen. 
Defendant appears in person/in custody from MCJ with Atty Francisco Araiza. 

Date and time set for JPTC; VRCW. 
Parties have reached an agreement.  
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

21CM1052>>
State moves to DRI Count 1 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater), Count 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater) and Count 3 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater); COURT GRANTS.

22CF424>>
State moves to AMEND Count 1 (Misappropriate ID Info -Avoid Penalty/Repeater) to Obstructing an Officer under 946.41(1); COURT GRANTS. 

PLEA: 
22CF424>>Amended Count 1 (Obstructing an Officer): GUILTY. 
22CF424>>Count 2 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor/Repeater):  GUILTY. 

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS on each count:  $100.00 fine plus court costs including DNA sample/surcharge. 

ADJ:  11:04 a.m.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Judicial Pretrial - in court on May 27, 2022 at 10:50 am.

INCLUDES 22CF424 & 21CM1052.  No contact with victim(s):  G.M.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.    No possession or consumption of controlled substances unless prescribed and only within the prescribed amounts.    Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Case Called: 2:22 pm
INCLUDES 22CF424 & 21CM1052.

State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher in person for ADA Lacey Coonen. Defendant appears in custody, via Zoom Video, and with Atty Adam Fontana in person.

- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
